Class DialogueBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.org.skloch.game.DialogueBox
  • public class DialogueBox
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to display a dialogue box for text and options on the screen.

      • setText

        public void setText​(java.lang.String text,
                    java.lang.String eventKey)
        Sets the text to be displayed on the dialogue box, automatically wraps it correctly Additionally, schedules an event to be called after the text is done displaying
        Parameters:
        text - THe text to display
        eventKey - The event key to be triggered

      • scrollText

        public void scrollText​(float speed)

      • initialiseLabelText

        public void initialiseLabelText​(java.lang.String text)
        Formats the text to be displayed on a label widget. Adds a newline character every MAXCHARS num of characters accounts for any occurring linebreaks to take use of the size of the most space possible. Stores the formatted text in 3 chunks, which are then queued up to be pushed to the label whenever the user presses e.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to format and push to the label

      • show

        public void show()
        Makes the dialogue box visible, along with any elements that need to be shown
